alert.note: Alert for Western Columbia River Gorge (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 19 at 3:22AM PST until December 19 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING ABOVE 500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 4 inches. * WHERE...In Washington, elevations above 500 feet in the Western Columbia River Gorge. In Oregon, elevations about 500 feet in the Northern Oregon Cascade Foothills and Western Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wet snow is possible down to river level, but additional accumulations should be less than 1 inch for most elevations below 500 feet.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions visit https://www.tripcheck.com or https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map or by calling 5 1 1
